relation: I don't require a dorm room, but I don't believe they have any either.

Don't pick a program at random. Choose 2 to 3 areas and research them. Look up the perspective jobs in the area, the physical and mental requirements, and the pay ranges. Interview the department heads, students in the programs, and those who are working in the fields already.

I am very impressed with the campus and the faculty at FTCC. My teachers and counselors have always been very helpful and understanding. I am looking forward to the next 2 years and earning my degree with FTCC.

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students 2 years looking to go to a university Tips for prospective students The tip I could give a student wishing to attend FTCC is to check your deadlines! Talk to your advisor quickly if you don't think your teacher is right for you. Talk to people about scholarship and financial aid as early as possible. Also! careful because some classes are non transferable!! Bang for the buck For a community college it is still somewhat pricey. For taking 4 classes along with all the necessary books the payment can be around 2,000 dollars. Seek financial aid early on!
